articles.title: Delhi-NCR AQI hits 481, offices ordered 50% staff
articles.summary: Delhi's air quality deteriorated to AQI 481 early Monday, with Noida at 557 and Greater Noida at 422, turning the region into a gas chamber. Authorities mandated 50% staff attendance in offices amid severe pollution. Schools shifted to hybrid mode due to hazardous conditions.

articles.title: Indian rupee falls to record low of 90.56 vs USD
articles.summary: The rupee weakened to a historic low of 90.56 against the US dollar overnight, marking its second straight week of decline. This development reflects ongoing economic pressures amid global factors. Markets opened with continued depreciation reported early Monday.

articles.title: Fadnavis announces Mumbai-Hyderabad expressway, metro expansion
articles.summary: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis announced the Mumbai-Hyderabad expressway, metro expansions, and power tariff cuts during the winter session's concluding debate late Sunday. The initiatives aim to boost connectivity and urban infrastructure. Government emphasized accelerating development projects statewide.

articles.title: Haryana divests IPS officer Shatrujeet Kapur of DGP charge
articles.summary: Haryana government removed Shatrujeet Kapur from DGP duties overnight, sending records of five IPS officers to UPSC for empanelment. A panel of three officers will be forwarded to the state soon. The move signals leadership changes in state police administration.

articles.title: BJP issues whip for Lok Sabha MPs in winter session
articles.summary: BJP directed all Lok Sabha MPs to attend House proceedings from December 15-19 as winter session enters final phase. The whip ensures presence amid key debates. This follows directives issued early Monday for substantive legislative business.

articles.title: Shinde criticizes Opposition over LoP demand in Maharashtra
articles.summary: CM Eknath Shinde slammed Opposition on winter session's last day for focusing solely on Leader of Opposition post instead of public issues. He accused them of failing to raise substantive concerns. The exchange highlighted ongoing political tensions in legislature.

articles.title: Delhi records second-worst December AQI at 461 Sunday night
articles.summary: Delhi's AQI reached 461 late Sunday, the second-worst December reading on record, due to weak winds and low temperatures trapping pollutants. This marked the most polluted day this winter. Overnight updates confirmed persistent severe conditions into Monday.

articles.title: NIA court declares Delhi blast accused Muzaffar Rather fugitive
articles.summary: An NIA court issued notices declaring Muzaffar Rather, accused in a Delhi blast case, a proclaimed offender early Monday. Notices were published in local papers and posted at his Qazigund residence in south Kashmir. The action follows his evasion of court summons.
